maml:description.maml:para: Close the SqlConnection.
Closes the connection and disposes of the underlying object. This will also rollback the current transaction if there is one.
User defined name for connection.
User defined name for connection.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Closes the default connection (same as Close-SqlConnection "Default").
Closes the SqlConnection named "Test".

maml:description.maml:para: Returns any available informational messages.
Get-SqlMessage returns any informational messages generated by the last Invoke-SqlScalar, Invoke-SqlQuery, or Invoke-SqlUpdate.
User defined name for connection.
User defined name for connection.
Invokes a bulk copy operation.

Invokes a bulk copy operation. This is highly optimized for MS SQL as the destination (using the .net SQLBulkCopy class). This is highly optimized for SQLite (wrapping inserts in transactions, per documentation). This is optimized for PostGre and Oracle (wrapping inserts in transactions) but not as efficient as vendor specific implementations of bulk inserts.

If you don't specify a SourceConnectionName or DestinationConnectionName, they will use the default (the cmdlet will fail is you don't specify at least one). If you don't specify DestinationTable, it will use SourceTable. DestinationTable is required if you use SourceQuery. If you specify ColumnMap and Source Table, then the select against the SourceConnection will be limited to the columns you specified in ColumnMap.
Returns number of rows copied.
User defined name for connection where data will be returned from.
User defined name for connection where data will be written to.
The name of the table in the source connection.
The name of the table to write to in the destination connection. If not specified, will be taken from SourceTable parameter.
Key is the column name in the source connection, Value is the column name in the destination connection.
How many inserts are batched together at one time.
How long, in seconds, that each batch can take. Defaults to the command timeout for the destination connection.
If present, as each batch completes a progress notification will be generated with the total number of rows inserted so far.
User defined name for connection where data will be returned from.
User defined name for connection where data will be written to.
A query to determine the source data, instead of a table.
Parameters needed for the source query.
The name of the table to write to in the destination connection. If not specified, will be taken from SourceTable parameter.
Key is the column name in the source connection, Value is the column name in the destination connection.
How many inserts are batched together at one time.
How long, in seconds, that each batch can take. Defaults to the command timeout for the destination connection.
If present, as each batch completes a progress notification will be generated with the total number of rows inserted so far.
User defined name for connection where data will be returned from.
User defined name for connection where data will be written to.
The name of the table in the source connection.
The name of the table to write to in the destination connection. If not specified, will be taken from SourceTable parameter.
Key is the column name in the source connection, Value is the column name in the destination connection.
How many inserts are batched together at one time.
How long, in seconds, that each batch can take. Defaults to the command timeout for the destination connection.
If present, as each batch completes a progress notification will be generated with the total number of rows inserted so far.
A query to determine the source data, instead of a table.
Parameters needed for the source query.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will copy rows from 'src'.testTable into 'dst'.testTable.
Will copy rows from 'src'.testTable into 'dst'.table2; only the columns Col1, Col2 and DT from the src will be copied into A, B, theDate in dst (respectively).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-SqlBulkCopy -SourceConnectionName src -DestinationConnectionName dst -SourceQuery "SELECT First, Last, BirthDate FROM employee WHERE status=@status" -SourceParameters @{status="dead"} -DestinationTable "deadEmployees" -ColumnMap @{First="fName";Last="lName";BirthDate="DOB"} -Notify -BatchSize 500 -BatchTimeout 180

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will copy rows from 'src'.employee table (based upon the query) into 'dst'.deadEmployees using the mapping (First = fname; Last = lName; BirthDate = DOB). Inserts will be batched into groups of 500, with an allowance of 3 minutes (180 seconds) to complete each batch. Progress notifications will fire after every batch completes.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes Sql Statement and returns data.

Invokes Sql statement and returns data. This can handle multiple result sets (if underlying provider supports it). If there are multiple result sets, the output is datatables, otherwise datarows. If the 'Stream' switch is used, only the first result set is returned and the output is PSObject represented a row.
SQL statement to run.
Parameters required by the query. Key matches the parameter name, Value is the value of the parameter.
User defined name for connection.
Uses a datareader to stream PSObject representing the results of the query to the pipeline, results will appear as soon as the connection begins returning data.
The timeout for this SQL statement, defaults to the command timeout for the SqlConnection.
SQL statement to run.
Parameters required by the query. Key matches the parameter name, Value is the value of the parameter.
User defined name for connection.
Uses a datareader to stream PSObject representing the results of the query to the pipeline, results will appear as soon as the connection begins returning data.
The timeout for this SQL statement, defaults to the command timeout for the SqlConnection.

myCalc ------ 11

Invokes a sql statement intended to return only a single value. If the sql statement generates multiple rows and/or columns, only the first column of the first row is returned.

maml:description.maml:para: Open a connection to a database server.
Open a connection to a database server. Supports SQL Server, SQLite, Oracle (10.2+), and PostGreSql.
Connection string for the sql connection.
Indicates this is a PostGre connection.
The default command timeout to be used for all commands executed against this sql connection.
User defined name for connection.

Indicates this is a MSSQL connection using Integrated Authentication.

The datasource for the connection. For MSSQL connections, defaults to "localhost"; for SQLite connections, defaults to ":memory:"; all other connections it is mandatory. MSSQL: Instance Name Oracle: host PostGre: Host SQLite: file path
Database catalog to connect to. This is not applicable for Oracle or SQLite connections. MSSQL: Master PostGre will require you to pass in a value.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Opens a MSSQL connection to 'localhost' database 'master' using Integrated Authentication.
Opens a MSSQL connection to 'localhost' database 'test' using Integrated Authentication and names the connection "TestConn"
Opens a SQLite connection to an in-memory database.
Opens a SQLite connection to the file "c:\somedir\someFile.db", will create the file if it doesn't exist, otherwise open it if it does exist.
Opens an oracle connection to the 'myOraSid' hosted on someServer:1551 with user 'test' and password 'mySecret'.
Opens a PostGre connection to the database 'MyDb' hosted on someServer:5432 (default port) with user 'test' and password 'mySecret'.
